summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys Robert Glassman and federal prosecutors regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling an interview with a victim/witness, subpoenaing her school records, and coordinating media coverage of a civil lawsuit filed on her behalf. The chain reveals ongoing investigative steps and legal coordination.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing a victim/witness in the Epstein investigation. He is coordinating with federal prosecutors regarding interviews, subpoenas, and media coverage of a civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.role: Attorney (likely at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP)
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence between Robert Glassman and federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation and client coordination.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.role: Attorney (likely at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP)
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence between Robert Glassman and federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: Identified as the judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim/witness represented by Robert Glassman.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Identified as the magistrate judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim/witness represented by Robert Glassman.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of the SDNY investigation and the civil lawsuit. His conduct is a topic the prosecutors intend to discuss with the victim/witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whose specific conduct the federal prosecutors intend to discuss with the victim/witness during a planned interview.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Referenced in a media link about the civil lawsuit, which alleges the victim/witness was introduced to him at age 14.

connections.description: Attorneys at the same law firm (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP), copied on the same correspondence.
Attorneys at the same law firm (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP), copied on the same correspondence.
Glassman represents a victim bringing a civil lawsuit against Epstein's estate.
Glassman is the attorney for a female victim/witness in the Epstein case, coordinating her interview with prosecutors and managing media related to her lawsuit.
The SDNY prosecution team is investigating Epstein and is seeking to interview the victim/witness, including subpoenaing her school records.
Both are subjects of the investigation, with prosecutors intending to ask the victim/witness about the conduct of both individuals.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of his client against Jeffrey Epstein. The filing is noted in media reports.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with Victim/Witness
events.description: A meeting is scheduled between the victim/witness, her attorney Robert Glassman, and federal prosecutors from the SDNY for an interview regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena for School Records
events.description: Federal prosecutors inform Robert Glassman they are subpoenaing and requesting student records from schools previously attended by the victim/witness to corroborate her timeline.

events.title: Previous Meeting with Victim/Witness
events.description: A prior meeting occurred between the victim/witness, her attorney Robert Glassman, and federal prosecutors.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation was actively pursuing witness interviews and corroborating evidence (like school records) in February 2020, months after Epstein's death.
A civil lawsuit was filed on behalf of a victim in January 2020, alleging Epstein molested her at age 13 and introduced her to Donald Trump at age 14.
Federal prosecutors were carefully coordinating with the victim's attorney to schedule interviews and manage contact to protect her from harassment.
The investigation aimed to gather information on the conduct of both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email chain shows a clear attorney-client relationship between Robert Glassman and a redacted victim/witness, with Glassman acting as an intermediary with law enforcement.
